descriptions.text: it is early morning
cold rain is melting the remaining snow hanging from the boughs of the surrounding trees
you are surrounded by evergreens.
douglas fir
you can make out a path heading into the fog
somewhere in your brain, you are sure
this path is etched deep and indelible. You could walk it in your sleep.
the ground sucks at your boots
the moss beckons
you are standing in front of the house you grew up in
it's been years since you've been back
you experience a strange mixture of feelings
melancholy, though maybe that's just the weather
pride, for leaving
apprehension, for what you know is inside
you tried to start a garden here once
you dreamt, specifically, of rhubarb in winter and tomatillos in summer
you dreamt of bringing these things to the dinner table and sharing them with your parents
it was a na√Øve aspiration, but who could fault you for such a desire?
the side yard has been unused, unvisited since
a space ceded to the damp and clamoring claw of the pacific northwest
a weathered shovel bears aged witness to your efforts
and the gate creaks in the wind
a mockery of the suburban backyard, with a pool and everything
mom wanted a pool but she hated to swim
dad hated the suburbs but loved pool maintenance
their charade worked until it didn't.
a relic of multicolored plastic survives in the swampy remains of the pool
you are unsettled.
the damp sets into your bones.
you do not wish to stay.
it is a cold cabin
someone somebody once loved, probably, is here
sitting alone at a table set for two,
dead.
diffuse light flows and pools and illuminates
why did I return?, you wonder
alack, there is no answer
you struggle to make out anything about them. The stench is magnificent.
